qas.question: As of 2004, how many kilometers of road existed in Nepal?
Why is travel in Kathmandu mainly via automobile or aircraft?
What highway connecting Kathmandu to elsewhere in Nepal is currently being built?
In what direction out of Kathmandu does the Prithvi Highway travel?
If one wished to travel north out of Kathmandu, what highway would be used?

context: The total length of roads in Nepal is recorded to be (<a0_0>17,182<a0_0/> km (10,676 mi)), as of 2003–04. This fairly large network has helped the economic development of the country, particularly in the fields of agriculture, horticulture, vegetable farming, industry and also tourism. In view of the <a1_0>hilly terrain<a1_0/>, transportation takes place in Kathmandu are mainly by road and air. Kathmandu is connected by the Tribhuvan Highway to the south, Prithvi Highway to the <a3_0>west<a3_0/> and <a4_0>Araniko<a4_0/> Highway to the north. The <a2_0>BP<a2_0/> Highway, connecting Kathmandu to the eastern part of Nepal is under construction.
